Posts.Content: Good luck, hope its good news for you  Big hugs Karri xx
Posts.Title: Today's the day

Posts.Content: I've been on Tamoxifen for just over a year now and have really stiff legs and pain in my right hip, I feel awkward walking these days xx I have also just put it down to Tamoxifen xx
Posts.Title: Hip pain - any ideas?

Posts.Content: Hi Chris,I too had similar to you although delayed recon but again no further treatment apart from tamoxifen xx
Posts.Title: No further treatment....worried!

Posts.Content: Hi Jude, You sound like you're in my sons position, he did have a brother that was hit by a car and killed when he was 21 in 2008, then I had to tell him I'd got cancer 6 months after his mate had died from lung cancer. I am honest with him and he seems to manage it well even though he's only 23 now. Its about taking one step at a time, there is no magic cure to how you feel, sites like this will help as talking is helpful, talk to your mum like a friend she will be more worried than you think, about you and what she has to go through. This is hard for you all, hugs to you all xxx Karri
Posts.Title: Just been told by mum she has breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Cass10 Please ring your local breast screening hospital or your doctor and ask them to chase this up asap as this is not good enough!!  Its the not knowing that is freaks you out! Good luck and let us know how you get on Big Hugs Karri XX
Posts.Title: mammogram ..??

Posts.Content: Thank you, this did make me giggle  Love to you all <3 xx
Posts.Title: Saw this and it made me smile

Posts.Content: :D thats really good and what I've had, didn't need radiotherapy but did need Mastectomy tablets and just had delayed Tram reconstruction, as it goes its very good news, well chuffed for you Big hugs Karri
Posts.Title: Got my biopsy results

Posts.Content: Hi, sleeping is not easy but if you were given or could get a small heart shaped pillow and use the point to just prop in under the small of your back to relieve the pressure and to tilt you sideways slightly it really does help. Hope all goes well with your treatment  Karri xx
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Hi, I wanted people to know so they wouldn't ask and to stop the whispers that also get enriched with wrong information about what was happening, so I announced it on my Facebook page so those that wanted to know read and those that didn't ignored it!! I now I update as each milestone passes and try to always keep it up beat. It helps me more than than others I think because it make me try and find positives out of what's happening........ Good luck to you and big hugs, you do and say what works for you Karri xxx
Posts.Title: What do i say? Odd question i know....

Posts.Content: I'd give your BC nurse a ring and ask for advise, hope all goes well for you Karri
Posts.Title: Totally new and clueless

Posts.Content: Bless you, Its a hellava shock to the system!! I had my mastectomy 31st November last year and sentinel node removal, I am now 1 month after a tans flap reconstruction and doing well. Have attitude and keep yourself as fit as possible and this is a journey that needs small teddy steps, you will get through this..... I am here for you as are everyone else on here, please contact whenever you need or want some one to talk too xxx
Posts.Title: Operation 10 sept - anyone else?

Posts.Content: Hi, Its all a steep learning curb but we have no choice but to manage... you do not say what op you are having on the 10th/?  hope all goes well for you, but if we know then we can comment on what you're having done, big hugs Karri
Posts.Title: Operation 10 sept - anyone else?

Posts.Content: Hi Hope you had a good sleep, you are right we are all different and want different things, the drains will hold you up as will the affected arm, all will heal and you do get better, good luck for the 10th xxx
Posts.Title: Operation 10 sept - anyone else?
